content.description: Tricky start leads to some good slab climbing above. Shares first bolt with Finding My Balance.
content.location: To the right of Finding My Balance. Bolt line straight up the slab.

content.description: Shares the same start with "Shave Your Bump". Make a tricky first clip. I stayed left and then went around the bulge to keep it at the grade. From there traverse left following a line of 7 bolts to the anchors. Little bit of slab climbing!
content.location: Left of the two bolted sport routes on the big slab that faces the road.

content.description:
While looking for Finding My Balance and Shave Your Bump (which I didn't end up finding) I came across this climb.  Well protected bolted every 6-7 feet or so, good holds at the start, easy climb until you come across a piton in the middle of the climb... Some slab and arete climbing after (I'm a low grade climber so I was trying to use whatever I could find), might be easier for others.

Anchors are pretty far back from the edge.  There were slings that looked really old (sun damaged) with rappel rings.  I would not use the existing slings, you can bring your own if you're willing to part with them.  Cleaning and rappelling with the rope through the anchored bolts is not recommended as it was very difficult to get the rope down.

Lastly, I don't think this is climbed often so there were a lot of loose gravel which rained down on my partner throughout the climb, also lost my footing a few times - 9/8/19.
content.protection: 6 Bolts, 1 Piton, 2 Bolted Anchors on top - about 5-6 feet past the edge.
content.location: Park at a turnout halfway to Split Rocks at the right side.  You can see a clump of rocks to the right of the road.  I marked it on the picture.
